alert.note: Alert for North Cass; North Itasca; South Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 3:43PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Itasca and northeastern Cass Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 342 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles southeast of Lavinia, to 12 miles northwest of Federal Dam, to near Bena, to 6 miles east of Lake Winnibigoshish, moving southeast at 10 mph. Additional storms will likely develop along this line before 415 PM. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lake Winnibigoshish around 350 PM CDT. Bena around 400 PM CDT. Deer River and Ball Club around 415 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Six Mile Lake, Portage Lake, Ball Club Lake, Cass Lake, Mud Lake and Schley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. These storms may intensify. Monitor local NOAA Weather Radio, commercial radio, or television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: North Cass; North Itasca; South Itasca
